situation: R often panicked when moving from recess back to the classroom, getting stuck on the playground.
action: Teachers began using a musical cue—playing a specific song when it was time to transition—to signal the end of recess. Additionally, a familiar teacher aide provided reassurance and physical presence to guide R back inside.
effect: The consistency of the musical cue became a comforting signal for R, easing her anxiety about returning to class. With the aid's assistance, transitions became smoother and more predictable.
topic: Transition Difficulties - Moving between different activities or spaces
